page.title: 11A DAY IN OUR SURVEY
page.content: AFTER GETTING PERMISSION FROM THE LANDOWNER , SEVEN OF US WENT OF TO SURVEY THE AREA ROUND COLDINGHAM LOCH. THIS IS PRIVATE LAND AND THE LOCH IS USED FOR TROUT FISHING . FIVE BOATS WERE OUT ON THE LOCH WHEN WE WERE THERE. ON THE LOCH WE SAW A FAMILY OF SWANS , TWO ADULTS AND SEVEN CYGNETS, SOME COOTS AND WATER HENS WERE ALSO ON THE LOCH. IN THE SHALLOW WATER NEAR THE EDGE , WE FOUND A LIZARD AMONG THE YELLOW FLAGS. WE RECORDED FOURTEEN DIFFERENT SPECIES OF WILD FLOWERS. OUR MOST INTERESTING FIND WAS AN IRON-AGE HILLFORT. ONE SIDE OF THE FORT WAS BUILT ON A STEEP ROCKY OUTCROP AND THE REMAINDER WAS SURROUNDED BY TWO RAMPARTS SEPARATED BY A DITCH. TTHERE WERE TWO ENTRANCES ,WHICH WERE NOT INN A STRAIGHT LINE SO THAT THEY COULD BE MORE EASILY DEFENDED. WE HAD A VERY INTERESTING TIME.
